questions.question: 1. Which of the following is the best description of a substring?

answers.a: Any combination of a subset of characters from a string in the same order as the string.
answers.b: Contiguous sequence of characters within a string in the same order.
answers.c: Any possible combination of the original set of characters present in the string.

explanations.a: Incorrect. A subsequence is the subset of characters from a string in the same order as the string, but characters don't need to be contiguous.
explanations.b: Correct. A substring is a contiguous sequence of characters within a string in the same order.
explanations.c: Incorrect. A subset is any possible combination of the original set of characters present in the string, regardless of order.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Option b correctly describes a substring.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following is not a prefix of the string "algorithm"?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is a valid prefix as it is a substring with initial index 0 and final index 3.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is a valid prefix as it is a substring with initial index 0 and final index 8 (a complete string is also a prefix of itself).
explanations.c: Correct. A prefix of a string must be a substring where the starting index is 0. This is a substring with initial index 2 and final index 3, so it is not a prefix.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This is a valid prefix as it is a substring with initial index 0 and final index 1.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following is a suffix of the string "vlabs"?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is a substring with initial index 0 and final index 3, but a suffix must end at the last character of the string.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This is a substring with initial index 1 and final index 3, but does not include the last character 's', so it is not a suffix.
explanations.c: Correct. This is a substring with initial index 1 and final index 4. Since the final index equals 4 (n-1 where n=5), it is a valid suffix of string "vlabs".
explanations.d: Incorrect. Option c is a valid suffix of the string.

questions.question: 4. In the KMP (Knuth-Morris-Pratt) algorithm, what is the purpose of the prefix table (also called LPS array)?

answers.a: To store all possible prefixes of the pattern
answers.b: To avoid unnecessary comparisons by utilizing information from previous matches
answers.c: To count the number of characters in the pattern
answers.d: To reverse the pattern for backward searching

explanations.a: Incorrect. The prefix table does not store all prefixes, but rather the length of the longest proper prefix which is also a suffix for each position.
explanations.b: Correct. The LPS (Longest Proper Prefix which is also Suffix) array helps avoid unnecessary comparisons by determining how many characters can be skipped when a mismatch occurs.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The prefix table stores information about prefix-suffix patterns, not just the character count.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The KMP algorithm does not reverse the pattern; it uses the prefix table to optimize forward searching.

questions.question: 5. What is the time complexity of the KMP string matching algorithm for searching a pattern of length m in a text of length n?

explanations.a: Incorrect. This is the time complexity of the naive string matching algorithm, not KMP. KMP optimizes this by avoiding redundant comparisons.
explanations.b: Correct. The KMP algorithm has a time complexity of O(n + m) where O(m) is for preprocessing the pattern to build the LPS array and O(n) is for searching through the text.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This would be highly inefficient. KMP achieves linear time complexity, not quadratic.
explanations.d: Incorrect. This complexity does not account for the text length n, which is essential in pattern matching.
